title: Ezreal Arc Shift and Blitz Pull Bug
body:
I have been having problems pulling Ezreal in game with blitzcrank. When I pull and he arcane shifts after I connect with the pull, he gets away. Is this supposed to happen? why does his arcane shift override my pull? in my last game this happened 3 times. I pull and connect then his arcane shift goes off and he doesn't travel towards me, instead he arcane shifts further back. It is really frustrating because it takes away my biggest advantage as a Blitz and his arcane shift doesn't state that it nullifies spells.

Has this happened to anyone else?

replies.body:
Due to the way displacement was coded into League, this is what's "meant" to happen. If a displacement occurs when another is in progress, then the latest one will take dominance. The entirety of a pull is considered to be one displacement, so if Ezreal cast Arcane Shift at any point before-hand, he would escape. A way to counter this is to shoot your hook to where you think he's going to Arcane Shift too, ala [Madlife style](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aqVeb0cRdzg&t=00m25s).

This also occurs with Nautilus, Thresh, and *any* form of crowd control. It's got an **uninterruptable cast time**, meaning that even if Ezreal is subdued to crowd control, the spell will still cast. The exact same thing happens when he's ulting, though it's less noticeable because it's not a mobility move.

You can look up a list of uninterruptable spell casts. I can't remember where I found it but remembering the common ones is really useful.
